problem: The $n$th term of a sequence is $a_n = (-1)^{n+1}(3n + 2)$. What is the value of $a_1 + a_2 + \dots + a_{100}$?
solution: $a_n$ is positive when $n$ is odd and negative when $n$ is even. Consider an arbitrary odd number $j.$ It follows that  \[a_j + a_{j+1} = (3j+2)-(3(j+1)+2)=-3.\] In $a_1+a_2+\cdots+a_{100},$ there are $50$ such pairings, so the sum is $(-3)(50)=\boxed{-150}.$
